translated: Buren, Arvid, captain, Grytgöl, born October 25, 1872 in Hällestad, Östergötland County, son of industrialist Johan Adolf B. and Alma Molander. Married in 1899 to Adrienne Milide, and had one child named Blanche born in 1900. He graduated from high school in Norrköping in 1892 and completed officer training in 1894. He served as a second lieutenant in the First Life Grenadier Regiment from 1894, was promoted to lieutenant in 1899, served in the reserves from 1904, and became a captain in the Second Life Grenadier Regiment in the reserves in 1917. He was chairman of the Grytgöls Bruk sick and funeral aid fund, as well as with the Rommetorp electricity and distribution association from 1919 to 1935, and with the Hällestads Savings Bank in 1932. He was a member of the board of the Östergötland Enskilda Bank's department in Finspång in 1938 and served as vice chairman of its board in 1942. He was also a board member of the Östergötland Savings Bank Association in 1940. From 1929 to 1942, he was chairman of the Hällestads and Tjällmo Households' Guild and served on the board of the Östergötland Hypothetical Association in 1925. Additionally, he served as chairman of the Hällestads parish council from 1919 to 1934. He was a former chairman of the municipality and its committees, unemployed and distress relief committee, agricultural representative, and homeowner representative. He was also the director of the Grytgöls estates from 1925. He served as a member of the Hällestad school council and church council in 1927, and as vice chairman of the church council in 1931. He was a member of the church council and school board in 1932, and also a member of the executive committee of the Swedish Farming Association's forestry section in South-Midland-Närke in 1938. He was the district forestry officer in Hällestad from 1942 and chairman of Grytgöls rifle corps in 1913. He received the Order of Vasa, the County Medal of Merit, Östergötland's Service and Merit Medal, and the Östergötland Rifle Association's Silver and Gold Medals.
